Name: Math Cat
Description:
Meow… meow… Aww, there are so many cute kittens that need to be adopted in Math Cat! But they are only interested to a person who bring their favorite stuff and number (yeah because it's a game of math of course). As a cat lover, you can attract their attention with different kind of lures that you have. Just be cautious that you are not the only one who interested in adopting these cats! So, are you ready to adopt these adorable creatures...with math?

The gameplay is simple. You, as a cat lover, want to adopt a cat by giving them a lure card that has a number on it. When the lure card(s) in play can be calculated equal to the number on the cat card, you deserve to adopt that adorable cat. The game ends when no lure card or no cat card can be acquired. The player who has collected the most cats wins.

There's also a speed mode in which your speed of counting is tested among your peers...but be careful, you must maintain your manner if you don't want those adorable cats run off from you.

Name: Sporks
Description:
Think fast before you pass! Dig into the fast-passing card game of Sporks. Choose which food to collect and race to get as many as you can, but stay sharp as you also need the right spork to win. The wild spork gives you the edge, but will you be quick enough to grab it?

—description from the publisher

Name: Bolt Action: Battle For Berlin
Description:
This entire war has led to this monumental moment in world history, this is the Allies chance to end it all, this is Battle for Berlin…

Hitler’s armed forces make their last stand in the German capital, Berlin. Facing them the vengeful Soviet Union, swarmed into the shattered streets of the Fatherland. Every inch of ground was paid for in the enemy’s blood, the fighting bitter and with no quarter asked nor given...

Fighting alongside veteran soldiers, young boys and old men of the Hitler Youth and Volkssturm stalked Soviet tanks with panzerfausts whilst Soviet heavy IS-2 tanks duelled with their King Tiger counterparts.

This Boltâ€ˆAction battle-set provides you with multi-storey buildings, barricades and shell holes around which to field the combined armour and infantry forces of the invading Red Army and the rag-tag German defenders.

—description from the publisher

Name: AceHole
Description:
AceHole is a remix of the most popular card game for drinking on college campuses: Asshole. 
Despite its popularity, the game asshole was never formalized with written instructions or rules.
AceHole fixes all that!
What makes our game so much different and (and better) than all of the games that are being played every day across the country in countless colleges and universities (since the beginning of time)?

     We have compiled all of your favorite rules and many new ones from all across the United States. We came up with over 100 drinking rules.
     No more memorization! All the rules will be laid in front of you on our cards!
     We have included a beautifully designed 54 card custom playing card deck.
     All cards are from the 54-card deck and rule cards are printed on 100% ALCOHOL PROOF PVC! NO MORE PARTY FOULS!


—description from the designer

Name: Die Kolonisten: Kaizo Kolonisten
Description:
This scenario, included in Lookout magazine "Neues vom Ausguck" is supposed to increase the difficulty of the game by alot. In short, you only play era 1 and without colonies.


Wer sich ein wenig in moderner Internet-Kultur auskennt, dem wird "Kaizo Mario" sicherlich ein Begriff sein - eine ultraschwere Version des beliebten Konsolenspiels "Super Mario World" von Nintendo. Dieses Szenario ist ganz im Sinne von "Kaizo Mario" unverschämt schwer und soll euch vor eine echte Herausforderung stellen. Wer traut sich?

English Translation:
Anyone familiar with modern internet culture will be familiar with Kaizo Mario - an ultra-hard version of Nintendo's popular console game Super Mario World. This scenario is outrageously difficult in the spirit of "Kaizo Mario" and should present you with a real challenge. Do you dare?

Name: Village of Legends: Ancient Guild
Description:
In this expansion box, we’ve added new mechanisms to the game that will diversify the battle ground and will also enable 6-player mode. Three Wolves and one Alpha Dog have been added to the Village of Legends bestiary. These Wild creatures can only be tamed and domesticated by only the wisest of masters.

This is an expansion to the base game Village of Legends with 2 more heroes (Druid & Cleric), 48 more cards, rules, dice & counters. Comes in a small tuck box which the base game box is designed to hold.

Name: Village of Legends: The Horde
Description:
Monsters! A big horde is coming from the south and you will face lots of angry creatures!

This rich expansion pack adds many brand new, never seen before cards which will reshape the battlefield.

The Heroes will have to fight against new monsters and creatures, however all is not lost, the gods have bestowed upon them many new strengthening powers and items.

Poison! Giant Spiders, Snakes and Scorpions are poisonous creatures and have the ability to leave a lasting affect on their victims. If the attack of this monster does at least one damage to a player’s hero this hero will also get infected by the monster’s poison and will receive a poison token. At the start of each turn before other monster’s attack, this hero will lose one LP for every poison token which he is infected by. This poison can only be cured by the use of specific cards.

Along with the new creatures In this box you will find: invisibility potions, powerful weapons, dwarven beers, well forged shields, and of course, two new Heroes: the Slayer and the Thief (one of which will have unique abilities).

Name: Scrabble: Big Eszett (ß)
Description: The capital German letter eszett (ß) as promo tile since it was added to the German language 2017. (The lower case already existed.)

Name: Fievel au Far-West
Description: Based on the animated movie An American Tail: Fievel Goes West, this game is a twist on the classic Game of Goose[/thing] with physical challenges between players.

Name: Kodama: The Tree Spirits – Kodama and Decree Cards
Description:
New promo card pack created primarily for the Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama kickstarter project.

Includes three Kodama cards and three Decree cards for Kodama: The Tree Spirits and six decree cards for Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama.

These cards were included in the base game of Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama as an exclusive item for Kokoro: Avenue of the Kodama Kickstarter backers (and those signed up to get rewards at Essen), with remaining stock available through conventions and special promotions only.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina
Series: Small Box Big Fun (Action Phase Games)

Name: The Snails on the Wall
Description: The Snails on the Wall game is a simple roll and move game where players move their piece along the playing board wall according to the roll of a die. The first to reach the top is declared the winner

Name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar: Twirl and Toss
Description: A child's game from Briarpatch.  Players take turns tossing pieces of plushy fruit onto the leaves and caterpillar (small hook and loop circles) as it twirls on a motorized base.  The first to stick all of their fruit wins the game.

Name: Eine Herde wilder Pferde
Description:
The herd of horses is spread out across the whole paddock. But when they are collected for riding, all the horses come to the gate at top speed.

An exciting game to support quickness and hand-eye coordination.

Every player gets a set of identical cards, which look like Domino stones and show one or two horses in different colors.

The paddock cards form a draw pile. Once a paddock card is flipped, all players try to arrange their cards in the form of the shown paddock card as quickly as possible.

The quickest player wins the paddock card. When the draw pile with the paddock cards runs out, the player with the most paddock cards is the winner of the game.
—user summary (English)

Die Pferdeherde hat sich über die ganze Koppel verteilt. Doch wenn sie zum Reiten abgeholt werden, kommen alle Pferde ganz schnell ans Gatter.

Ein spannendes Ablegespiel, bei dem neben Schnelligkeit auch die Augen-Hand-Koordination gefördert wird.

Jeder Spieler erhält einen identischen Satz an Pferdekarten, die wie Dominosteine aufgebaut sind und 1 oder 2 Pferde in unterschiedlichen Farben aufweisen.

Vom Stapel mit den Koppelkarten wird eine Karte aufgedeckt und alle Spieler versuchen gleichzeitig, die Koppel so schnell wie möglich nachzubauen.

Der jeweils schnellste Spieler bekommt die Koppelkarte als Belohnung. Wer am Ende die meisten Koppelkarten gewonnen hat, gewinnt auch das Spiel.
—user summary (German)

Name: Lorenzo il Magnifico: New Leaders #2
Description:
This small promo expansion was available at Spiel'17 in Essen. 
It adds 2 new leaders (Carlo VIII & Jacopo Salviati) to play with the base game.

The New Edition of Lorenzo il Magnifico already include this promo.

Name: Countdown: Action Edition
Description:
Dog Might Games is back with its newest title Countdown: Action Edition! With a short play time, tons of player options, built-in moderator, and unique role-playing mechanics, Countdown: Action Edition delivers a totally new hidden role experience.

One reckless Action Hero.
An out of control hostage situation.
Who will you trust?

In Countdown: Action Edition players become characters within a 1980’s action flick. Villains have taken hostages and rigged the whole place to blow, but they didn’t count on the timely arrival of the Action Hero. Thinking fast they’ve hidden themselves among the hostages waiting to be released. There’s not enough time to save everyone. Get the innocent hostages out while leaving the bad guys behind to fall victim to their own plots. Unfortunately for our Hero, many of the hostages also have their own plans to use this situation to their advantage.

The new Countdown Deck system creates exciting tension by randomly triggering the end of the game. Since no one knows which card will be the bomb every decision is critical, and games stay fast and fun.

A moderator is built directly into gamplay through the Action Hero. Making sure that everyone gets in on the fun while still keeping the game organized and flowing.

Action Scene Cards make sure that every player gets an opportunity to take center stage and can redirect the movie scene with unexpected plot twists.    
 Role Playing is a core part of gameplay making each game a hilarious and different experience. Watch your friends drop epic one liners and do their best 80’s movie impressions. The amazing art from Andrew Thompson is designed to help everyone, from new role players to experienced actors, get into character.

Jam packed with nostalgia and humor, Countdown: Action Edition offers many new twists on the beloved hidden role genre.

—description from the publisher

Name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – Egg promo card
Description:
The Egg promo card is a single card addition for Serengeti: A Race for Life that was first given away free to visitors at Spiel '17 in Essen, on purchase on the game.

Its availability was thereafter limited to the first year after the release of the game, including at trade shows attended by the publisher, direct sales from their website, and the Kickstarter campaign for the 'Revised Edition' of the game launched in June 2018.

Name: Riga: Honorary Citizen
Description:
Promo given with the purchase of the base game at Spiel '17 in Essen.

Surplus spendings when building is donated to the city. Who has the single highest donation at game end gets 3 VP.

Name: Buzz Around
Description:
In Buzz Around the players control a swarm of insects and try to get through a field of flowers, surviving the hazards that threaten them! In addition to the basic roll and move system the game adds interesting decision points with clever card play and choosing the optimal route through the ever rotating flowers.

The player who first gets his or hers swarm safely through the field wins the game!

Name: Out of Order
Description:
Have you heard the hit song “WES WILL COOK JOE”?  Or seen the classic movie “YOUR WRIST PUMP”?  How about the children’s book “FOOD FIGHT DUDE”?  What?  You mean you don’t know them?  That’s because they’re OUT OF ORDER!  Take away a letter here, add a letter there and in 5 steps the correct answer is revealed!  Clues are read one at a time.  Be the first to unscramble and identify the OUT OF ORDER title to win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Freaks: Prophecy – The 19th Head Promo Card
Description:
The 19th Head: Prophecy has a once per round ability. It allows the player to look at the next two Arena Master cards and lets them put the cards back in any order.

The promo card was available at Spiel '17 in Essen.

Name: ATK! The Board Game
Description:
ATK! The Board Game is a 2 player 3v3 MOBA Style Board Game. Assemble your team of 3 Elemental Heroes. Each Hero has a spinnable base that is used for the attack mechanism. Your team is also equipped with 2 towers and a base. These structures have a health system that is easy to keep track of with a counting system built in.

Your goal is to destroy your opponent's base while protecting your own. Any time you defeat enemy Heroes you earn specialty cards that can assist you to victory. These cards include damage boosters for single attacks, respawn delays to assign to your opponent's hero, and much more.

Battling structures is simple, choose your Hero, flip upside down and spin the spinner. Reference your Hero Cards to add a value or action to your spin's outcome. If it's an attack, subtract that amount to the structure's health. Deplete all health on a tower and it is removed from play giving you a clear path to the base. When attacking an enemy Hero, flip both Heroes over and spin. Higher number wins without elemental influence.

Strategically maneuver your way into your opponent's base area and destroy their base. Upon doing so, claim the title of the ATK! Champion. Reset and Play Again!

—description from the designer

Name: Team Yankee: Stripes – US Forces in World War III
Description:
The United States has the most powerful armed forces in the world. Three army corps stand ready to defend Western Europe from the red horde poised across the Iron Curtain. Armored troops' powerful M60 Patton tanks or state of the art M1 or IPM1 Abrams tanks, mechanized infantry mounted in reliable M113 personnel carriers, and light infantry of the 82nd Airborne all stand ready to stop the red tide. Cavalry and scouts deploy forward in tanks, APCs and HMMWV vehicles to thwart the enemy's progress, while anti-aircraft troops with gun and missile vehicles watch the skies. The US Marine Corps' amphibious troops are ready to be deployed where needed with their own tanks, Light Armored Vehicles, and hard fighting infantry, backed by their own support. Those commies won't know what hit them!

Inside you will find:

     Background on the US 7th Corps, 1st Armored Division, Combat Team Alpha, 82nd Airborne Division, and the 2nd Marine Division.
     Instructions on how to build a M1 Abrams Combat Team, M60 Patton Combat Team, Mech Combat Team, Armored Cavalry Troop, Cavalry Troop, Infantry Combat Team, Marine Tank Company, Marine Infantry Company, and LAV Company.
     Three scenarios that drop you into the actions of an Armored Combat Team.
     A detailed painting guide to help you prepare your US Forces for combat.

Name: PreyCare
Description:
For whatever reason, all of the freakishly aggressive predators in your care have escaped!  The surrounding wildlife is in danger!  As one of the only park rangers on duty, it’s your job to protect all of the adorable creatures in your reserve.  You are the only thing stopping a predator from an all you can eat baby buffet.
Most games require a high score to win - not this game.  In PreyCare, you reduce your score by matching up cards in the same column.  The lower your score, the less blood you’ll have on your hands.  Be careful though, matching up cards activate special abilities that may not be what you were hoping for!

The game is simple.  You have to match cards in the same column.  Failure to match up the cards means you have screwed up and your baby creature gets mauled.  Most games require you to have the highest score in order to win.  Not this game though.  Each point above zero is blood on your hands.  The player with the lowest score by the end of the game is the “winner”.  Reducing your score is simple: whenever you match two cards in the same column, their numbers cancel each other out and their value becomes zero.  If you don’t match a column up, well we have bad news for you.  You gotta add the numbers together – it’s basically a kill count, you failure.  Add up all columns together, and the player with the least amount of carcasses is as close to a winner as they come – considering the fact that you’re dealing with adorably dead animals.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zooloretto: Rabbits
Description:
You can bring the rabbits in play by exchanging them with another animal type of your choice. All the rules of the original game apply without any changes.

The Rabbits consists of 5 fertile males, 5 fertile females and 5 bunnies, because we all know they breed like rabbits...

The rabbits were a promotional item, available on Abacusspiels homepage. They were also released as part of the Zooloretto Goodie-Box at Spiel in Essen 2017.

Name: Confabula Rasa
Description:
Confabula Rasa is a cooperative word construction and storytelling game for two to six players featuring a deck of non-linear word fragment cards. You play as ghosts possessing a group of kids in a cabin in the woods, trying to figure out how you died by piecing together your fragmented memories.

Play is started by shuffling the 26 double-sided word fragment cards (Fewer cards can be used for a faster game). Each player is dealt one card (they can flip the card to the other side at any time). One card is placed in the middle of the table. Any player may start play. The first player places the card from their hand onto the tableau so that it forms a word using one or more letters from the card already in the tableau. The player may put the card on top of the card already on the table, or slide the card underneath, as long as the card on the table is not shuffled around. When the first player has formed a word, they draw a word fragment card from the pile and point to another player. The player pointed to must start to tell the story of the death of the ghosts from the ghosts’ point of view, incorporating the word that was just made. For example, if the first player formed the word “angst,” the player they pointed to could say: “The last thing I remember is a feeling of angst as I slumped through the halls.”

Any player may go next by adding their card to the growing tableau to make a new word and pointing to a player to continue the story (as long as a player does not make a word twice in a row). Play continues until all the cards in the deck and players' hands are gone. The last person to make a word points to the player who will bring the story to a satisfactory close in which "Everyone dies!"

The inspiration behind the game is "anyone can be a storyteller!"

—description from the designer

Name: Subrogator Cave
Description:
"Voter Beware" (SubrogÄtor Cave, in Latin) is a political dice  rolling game about Food Truck politics. Bernie Salad, Hilaire, Gervais Juanson, and  Donny Sausage all wish to become President of the Food Truck Association, the political position which controls all of the menus on local food trucks. In this game, one to four players will take turns rolling four dice and assigning them to each candidate, who in turn will utilize the die assigned them based on its value.

Possible actions include buying influence, buying votes, enhancing your influence with a funding PAC, or delivering a nasty Dirty Trick to an opponent's campaign, lowering their stature with PACs and potentially hurting their ability to compete. At the end of each turn, a Scandal may erupt which damages a candidate's reputation with the voting blocs that they buy votes from.

This is a unique, one to four-player political game that takes between 20-40 minutes  to play, and with simple-to-understand rules but truly difficult decisions each turn, it's perfect for a coffee shop or lunch hour either by yourself or with friends.

—description from the designer

Name: UltraQuest: Gold, Ruhm! und Ehre! – Der Oger Character Expansion
Description:
"Der Oger" is another Character, which can used in the Party.
This Expansion contains the rules for "Der Oger" as well as his character sheets, two Oger-Egg Token and envelope, which acts as hideout.

Name: Wat een file!
Description:
Stau-Mau Mau is a family game from the 'Haba Reisspeile' collection.

This game is similar to Uno.  You get to a number of different car tokens in different colors.  On the central gameboard you need to put down your tokens and get rid of all of them.  You can put a vehicle after a vehicle of the same color or the same shape.  As you lay out your pieces you create a big traffic jam across the board.  Some cars have no special function others make the next player to skip a turn, give the player an extra turn or makes the next player take more tokens.

The goal of the game is to get rid of all your tokens, when you have one token left, you need to shout something or you need to take a new token from the reserve.

The game is played totally on magnetic surfaces which is nice.  The players get their magnetic tokens on parking lot cards in their hands to keep them secret.  The board is laid out in the tin lid thus making it magnetic itself.  This makes it perfect to play everywhere.

There are 32 car tokens, 3 parking lots and one main board in the box.

Name: Lords of Hellas: Lord of the Sun
Description:
Lord of the Sun expansion consists of Apollo monument (5 parts), 6 muse models, 10 blessing cards from Apollo, 9 muse cards.

This expansion will bring very fresh elements to the game together with additional monument that will come with a lot of new powers.

Apollo monument will help you to:

Recruit Muses 
    Choose upcoming events 
    Refresh your special actions (only for you!) 
    Use monsters on the board

Muses will change the game dramatically - once you will recruit it in region under your control they will be able to help you in many ways. They will act like a hero (so they can't be attacked by other armies) and depending on what muse you will get (there will be 9 muse cards that will determine her special abilities) they will add special bonuses such us healing wounds, increasing statistics or gathering hero tokens.

When on board, they will help you get glory tokens - for example if win a battle in a region where your muse(s) is in - you will get glory token for that land.

—description from the publisher

Name: Lords of Hellas: City of Steel
Description:
This expansion pack lets you add another player to the game, expands map and adds new upgrade mechanic to the game.

In City of Steel expansion pack you can join the fight as Hector, legendary hero of Troy. It will also give you opportunity to hunt two new monsters - Satyr and Arachne, get on 3 new quests, upgrade your armies and conquer Troy itself!
This pack expands number of possible players to 6.

—description from the publisher

From the Rulebook: City of Steel requires the use of the Atlantis and Poseidon expansions found in the Lost City expansion.

Name: Lords of Hellas: Leonidas
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive leader to choose from during setup.

Starting Bonus: Leonidas starts with 2 Combat Cards.

Special Ability: During Battle, your Combat Cards gain +1 Strength for each Casualty Symbol on them.

This makes him a really great warrior in the game.

Name: Lords of Hellas: Atlas
Description:
This expansion can be used in game twofold. It will get you Garden of Hesperides and Atlas Overload expansions.

Will you help mighty Atlas carry weight of the world? Or will you steal Golden Apples from mythical Garden of Hesperides? Those expansions come in this package with:

Plastic Atlas monument (120 mm height)
    15 Golden Apple tokens
    Plastic weight token
    Double-sided board

This expansion will have 2 ways of usage: Atlas overload / The Garden of the Hesperides!

In Garden of Hesperides Atlas will be very unique "monument" - here are some highlights:

Starts game already fully build (miniature comes in 1 part)
    Players can send up up to 6 soldiers to it (instead of priests) 
    Thanks to sacrificing soldiers you can collect Golden Apples
    Golden Apples are your additional resource you will be exchange instantly during game for various bonuses, such us: Healing Hero wound, saving solider from death, adding army strength to battle and exchanging more Apples will grant more epic bonuses.  
    Atlas can carry alternative side of the board with The Garden of the Hesperides.

You will be able to use model for both Atlas overload and The Garden of the Hesperides - so by adding this expansion you get 2 gameplay additions! 
The Garden of the Hesperides expansion:

It will create a lot of cool situation and excitment with additional resources that can be instantly used in very different situation.

In this expansion, you can choose to start with Atlas as a 4th monument. He comes into the game fully build.

Players using their normal action can send maximum of 1 hoplite from any region (this rules will be different for 2 players) under Atlas. They stay there until all 6 slots will be covered (building monuments have no effect on them). Once 6 slots are fully covered, all players sacrifice hoplites to Atlas and in return he steals Golden Apples from Garden of the Hesperides.

Each player will get as many Golden apple tokens as many hoplites he had under monument.

Golden apples can be "consumed" at any time of the game and will have various effects: From healing hero wounds, saving hoplite's, adding strength to battle to more powerful effects if you will choose to consume more then one apple. 
Reminder - Atlas Overload rules

This expansion will negate winning condition, that the game ends once any monuments gets fully build.

You will place Atlas miniature next to a Board with Atlas Overload board and place "weight" token on 0 on the track. Whenever a new temple / part of monument or monster will appear on the Board - you will be adding weight on Atlas shoulder.

Once weight token will reach 12, Atlas systems shut-down and his crisis procedures are starting. From now on at the end of every players turn, you will decrease the weight value by 1. Once it will reach 0 - Atlas systems shut down completely and world falls apart. All players loose the game.

But you can help Atlas carry his weight! You will put "Aid to Atlas" quest token in one of the regions. Players can delegate their heroes to help atlas - if they will, they are removing their hero out of the board for the rest of the game, but increase the weight track by the value of their strength (so "add turns").

This expansion will change a little bit dynamics of the game and create a ticking "clock" that will count the time before the inevitable end of the game.

Name: ダイスキングチェス (Dice King Chess)
Two Player Wizard
Description:
A new set for the classic trick-taking game Wizard, now playable by only two players. This deck includes 36 cards and some new rules.

3 cards are set aside at the beginning, and one of them is turned up to establish the current trump. The remaining cards are divided in 3 groups of 11 cards; each player takes one, and the remaining one forms the dummy deck. Three cards are turned face up from the dummy deck.

Players bid on how many tricks they think they will take in the coming hand. Next the first player plays a card from their hand, then a card from the dummy's hand, and then the second player plays a card. The trick goes to the first player who played a Wizard, or by the player who played the highest trump, or to the player who played the highest lead card. Jesters always lose. The dummy player may win a trick, and in fact its role is to help the first player winn or lose a trick as needed.  The player who won the round becomes the first player and starts the next round.

When players run out of cards, they check their bids and score. You score for making your bid exactly, and lose points if you did not make your bid.
This version also has a special card that cancels the trick in which it is played - no one scores that trick.

First player to score 100 points is the winner.

Name: Cube War
Description: Cube War  is a 2 player area control game set in the Sengoku period in Japan. Players will draft battle cards at the start of the game to use in battles through out the game. Each player will fight over the areas on the map with cubes and the game is won when a player have the most victory points at the end of the game.

Name: Sabuesos
Description:
Julia, Paul, and their friends have hidden bones in the garden for seven little naughty dogs to play and find them. Will you be able to remember where they are and recover as many bones as you can?

The goal in Naughty Dogs is to explore the garden and gather the most bones buried in it. But watch out, because sometimes you will find trash buried in the garden a long time ago. Bones score Victory Points... but the trash takes away Victory points!

In turns, each player must Explore or Dig. When you explore, you choose an unoccupied Garden tile and look at its hidden side, making sure no one else can see it. If you want, you can take one of the dogs and place it on the tile so it goes sniffing around that part of the garden.

If you choose to dig, you take a tile with a sniffing dog from the centre of the table and place them in front of you. That tile is now yours and the rest of the players can't place dogs on it,

The game ends when a player has 5 Garden tiles. Then, everyone turns over their tiles and score a victory point for every bone, but takes away a point for every tile with trash. The player with most Victory points is the winner!
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: The Garden Bird Game
Description:
A simplified P-n-P board game with small play tiles with a design of play for younger players to help with matching four types of birds in a garden, counting colours (flower beds), counting scores along a score track, taking turns and taking tiles from a cup or bag.  The game can also be played by older players as well, as there are Advanced Optional Rules included – the game can actually get quite tactical for older players. The game is designed for 2 players but can be played with 4 in pairs.

The correct placing of the bird types and the 'wild tile' fish pond tiles scores points which are recorded on the included score track and the winner has the highest score at the end of the game.  There is also some final end-game scoring of only the coloured background tiles of the birds that have been placed within each players own columns of garden squares.  Bonus points can also be scored by correctly placing the 'wild tile' fish ponds in a player's garden column.

This P-n-P home-made test version includes the game-board (that represents a garden of squares and a score track), a counter-mix and a set of game rules for use by families with younger (and older) gamers at BGG to try out.  It should only take about 15-30 mins to play a game.

Name: Vae Victis
Description:
Rome is going to hell. Redneck barbarians are raiding the borders, the economy is in freefall, and the sewer workers are on strike...again. To top it all, mercenaries and slaves have delusions of grandeur (they want to be paid, for Jupiter's sake!), while those petty pencil pushers at the Senate indulge in never-ending rhetoric displays. As a wealthy patrician, you're pretty sure it is expected that you lend your help to Rome in this dire time of need, but then again will your "friends" do the same? The Ides of March are around the corner...'

Vae Victis is a semi-competitive game of decline and treachery for 1 to 6 Roman patricians. The phrase "Vae Victis" — Latin for "woe to the vanquished" or "woe to the conquered" — suggests that those defeated in battle are entirely at the mercy of their conquerors and should neither expect nor request leniency. Keep that spirit in mind when playing this game. Players take turns alternatively, and on their turn, they must go through three phases:


     Doom phase: The player rolls the three doom dice, eliminates one of them, then applies the result of the remaining two dice.
     Support phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots LIMITES, AERARIUM, or DOMUS PALATINA, possibly pushing their luck!
     Influence phase: The player can take up to two actions in any combination in the action spots THERMAE, FORUM, or CURIA.


After this, play passes to the next player. Play continues until a winning condition is met, with the conditions being as follows:


    All players lose if one of the wars is lost or one of the tracks reaches the final space. No player can decide to lose a war or make a track reach its final space if they can avoid it — unless they are the traitor (see below).
    A player loses at the end of any turn if they've run out of coins.
    A player wins at the end of their turn if they simultaneously fulfill the requirement of their goal card "SENATE" and their goal card "WAR".
    A player wins at the end of any turn if all other players have lost.


Note that any player can be a traitor to Rome, and they win if a condition is met that results in all players losing the game.

Name: The Brainiac Game
Description: In The Brainiac Game, players spin the SMART Spinner, then compete to answer questions in five subject areas: Science, Math, Arts, Reading, and The World. Each Question Card has six different questions tailored to grades 1 to 6, so that players answer questions corresponding to their grade levels. The first player to fill his or her brain with SMART Tokens wins!

Name: 2WW
Description:
2WW is a card game about World War II, the result of a careful historical research that we hope can be appreciated by fans of this subject. It uses an easy and completely-innovative gaming system. In never-repetitive game sessions, you can be one of the main players of the conflict, use the most horrible but celebrated events in your favour, and recreate legendary armies and units. It will be decisive the moment in which you decide to go to war, but above all the strategy that you will pursue to achieve the ultimate victory (economic or military).

—description from the designer (translated)

2WW è un gioco di carte sulla seconda guerra mondiale frutto di una attenta ricerca storica che ci auguriamo possa essere apprezzata dagli appassionati dell’argomento. Esso utilizza un sistema di gioco immediato e del tutto innovativo. In partite mai ripetitive, potrete impersonare i maggiori protagonisti del conflitto, utilizzare gli eventi più nefasti e celebri a vostro favore e ricreare eserciti ed unità a volte leggendari. Sarà determinante il momento nel quale deciderete di entrare in guerra ma soprattutto la strategia che perseguirete per arrivare alla vittoria finale (economica o militare).

—description from the publisher (Italian)

Name: Tour Guide
Description:
Tour Guide is a solitaire tile laying game. 
As a tour guide you must map out the city, making sure to create all the locations of your tour's itinerary.

There are 4 different scenarios and, depending on the type of tour, you'll need to visit museums and galleries, parks and piazzas, as well as local restaurants.
The more sights your party experiences, the more points you'll score.
And if there's a historic landmark, world famous masterpiece or culinary speciality to take in along the way, then all the better.

If you manage to create all the itinerary locations, then you ‘walk’ your tour route through the city for bonus points.

The game is just 2 pages of tiles/cards and 1 page of rules. You'll also need some small cubes or similar tokens for tracking.

Tour Guide was joint winner of the 2017 Mint Tin Design Contest

Name: First Class: Module F – Storage and Factory
Description:
This is a mini expansion for the game First Class by Helmut Ohley.
Components: 24 Module cards (8 in 3 pile colors), 1 Toolbox card
Module cards: In the storage you can find all sorts of useful things. Factories help you to upgrade your railroad cars.

- Description from publisher

Name: IsBut Cooking
Description:
Aim of the game: Collect the most number of the IsBut's and Cut Spaghetti recipes.

Flow of the game: Players either use function cards, play recipe cards, or pass and draw cards.

End of the game: When the deck runs out, the player with most recipe cards wins.

Name: Egged On
Description:
From the box:
Watch out for runny eggs!
Spin the spinner, pick an egg, and press it on your head! If you get splashed by an egg, you're out!

Contents:
Plastic egg carton
10 refillable plastic eggs
Spinner (with plastic arrow and base)
Game rules

Game play:
Before the game a number of the soft-plastic eggs are opened, half-filled with water, and re-closed. The number is the number of players minus one. The eggs are then wiped dry and randomly placed in the carton. The spinner has eight sections: two each of "egg", "2 eggs", "egg another", and "pass". A turn consists of spinning the spinner and doing what it says. For "egg" and "2 eggs" the player selects an egg and presses it on their head, one at a time. For "egg another" the same is done TO another player of their choice. For "pass" nothing happens. Play then passes clockwise. If a player has water on their head, they are immediately out of the game and the turn is over (even if it was the first egg of "2 eggs"). The last player left is the winner.

There is a variant involving filling only one egg no matter how many players there are, and whoever gets water on their head is the winner.

Name: Paulchen Pups
Description: Children's game. Spin a spinner to see how many pumpings of air you can use. After a certain amount of them, the air pressure will make the dog poop a foamy ball. The player whose turn it is will score a point. Most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Oskars Raketen Chaos
Description: Children's game. Load the rocket with mini stars and start the timer. On players' turns they roll the die and place buckets around the rocket. After the timer runs out, rocket will launch and spread the stars. Players will get the stars that end up in their buckets. First to fill their board with stars is the winner.

Name: BattleTech: The Wars of Reaving
Description:
Descendants of the Star League Defense Force, they returned to the Inner Sphere in 3050 with violence and honor. Stalled by the combined might of the Inner Sphere, the Clans have been waiting for the chance to strike for Terra once more. But fractures within Nicholas Kerensky’s Great Society have widened. A new enemy threatens to destroy the Clans once and for all: themselves. The resulting Wars of Reaving touches every Clan: some will be destroyed, all will be forever altered.

The Wars of Reaving sourcebook details the Clans from 3067 through the end of the Jihad era and includes detailed reports, faction updates, personalities, units, and equipment that have a hand in this widespread orgy of war. Essential gameplay statistics, maps, and a complete campaign allow players to immerse themselves completely within these Wars of Reaving.

—description from the publisher

Name: Snowbirds: Sunset Sky
Description:
Sunset Sky expands Snowbirds with 18 new Map cards, introducing 4 new location effects, offering a whole new landscape for your flock to explore. In addition to new bonuses and hazards, it also provides a new deck of Actions and rules to adapt the solitaire experience into a 2-player game. With a second flock in the sky, you can compete to see who can better manage the long journey south with their limited actions and resources. Players willing to take greater risks can gain an edge in an already tense race for survival. Can you bring your birds home?

This expansion requires the base game to play.

Name: Classic BattleTech: Blake Ascending
Description:
The Early Years of the Jihad

November 3067 saw the culmination of work two centuries in the making, work begun by Primus Conrad Toyama of ComStar, successor to Jerome Blake and the man responsible for single-handedly turning ComStar into a pseudo-religious organization with a vision: to lead mankind to the light...by any means necessary.
When the Star League self-destructs, a shadowy power behind the fanatical Word of Blake pulls the strings taut in righteous anger, launching a war to bring humanity to its knees. Confusion reigns, and each faction finds itself isolated amid its own turmoil. Yet as a new decade dawns, glimpses of the greater whole begin to appear through the dark clouds. The true battle has only just begun.

Blake Ascending: A Jihad Compilation is an omnibus reprint of Dawn of the Jihad and Jihad Hot Spots: 3070; the first two sourcebooks in the seminal Jihad plot line. The Blake Ascending sourcebook shakes the Classic BattleTech universe to its foundation, documenting the opening years from 3067 to 3070. The series of events presented in this book unfold in a rolling format, allowing readers to immerse themselves more directly into the action than ever before. Players of both Classic BattleTech and Classic BattleTech RPG will find framework rules to run any type of campaign in regions through out the Inner Sphere during this chaotic time.

Notes:

Blake Ascending is a reprint of Dawn of the Jihad and Jihad Hot Spots: 3070, in one volume. Except for errata, no changes have been made to the contents.
Editors: whenever you cite Blake Ascending in an article, please also cite the relevant pages from the other two books. In Blake Ascending, the first 160 pages match those of Dawn of the Jihad exactly (ex: BA p. 137 is the same as DotJ p. 137). All pages after p. 160 correspond with Jihad Hot Spots: 3070, when 160 is subtracted from the BA page number (ex: BA p. 200 is the same as JH:3070 p. 40). The reprinted JH:3070 table of contents is on pp. 162-163 in BA.

Name: Evolve: Lights of the Deep
Description:
Evolve: Lights of the Deep is a fast-playing card game for 2-4 players, set in the abyssal depths of the ocean. Within the all-consuming darkness of the sea, each player begins life as a single-celled organism and must go through evolutionary progressions to become the most complex life form. Evolve is a competitive game that involves aspects of hand management, tactical decision making and a take-that style of sabotage.

In the game, players need to establish evolutionary links to their current life form, before being able to progress to the subsequent level of organism. Many organisms and evolutionary links have additional bonuses or dual uses, so players are often required to make decisions about when to play cards, or when to keep them in hand. Additionally, ‘adaptation’ cards can also be used to increase the development of your organism, or to hinder players.

During each turn, players perform 6 moves, where they can choose to pick-up, discard or play cards (each action costs 1 move). Evolve gameplay is intuitive yet simple (this is a family-friendly game), while also allowing for various strategies and play styles.

—description from the designer

Name: Alveol: Das Zellenspiel
Description:
Every player takes one box with square plates and one roll with rings of the same color. The 1st player places a square plate vertically into any slit of the board. Then the 2nd player places one into any slit he likes and so on. If there is a square with 3 walls the player whose turn it is to play, must shut it by placing the 4th wall. If the square which he has shut, has no number, the next player continues to play. Otherwise the same player has another turn. In shutting one square the respective player puts one of his rings into it. The squares without number count 1, those with a number count as many points as are indicated by the number.

When all squares are shut, the points are counted and the player who has the most, is the winner.

Name: Cube Words
Description:
Cube Words is a print&play word game for 2 players. Earn points by forming words using adjacent letters. First player to earn exactly 30 points is the winner.

In his turn, each player can form a 3+ letters word using orthogonally adjacent letters and earn points according to the number of letters. Longer words are considerably more valuable than short words.

After forming a word, each player can use a cube to block a chosen letter. This letter can not be used by the other player.

Each player can only pass through the 20 points mark if he has formad at least one 6+ letters word.

To make things a little more difficult, the winner is the player who reachs exactly 30 points. If you earn more than 30 points, you begin to reduce your scoring!

The game was designed for the 2017 9-Card Nanogame P&P Design Contest.

THE COMPONENTS

All you need to play Cube Words is:

- The cards fronts and backs (one A4 sheet for each)
- 8 cubes, in 2 different colors (4 for each player)

Name: Dragon Brew: Expansion Pack One
Description:
This 31 card expansion adds four additional player races.

All the races in this expansion have 8 race cards, except Tree Men which have 7.

Tree Men
Leprechaun
Free Gnomes
Fairy Folk

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 7 – New Gods
Description:
The DC Comics Deck-Building Game Crossover Pack series is a way to breathe new life into your game with just a few tweaks. Grab your favorite DC set and instead of using the Super Heroes and Super-Villains from that set, use the ones from this pack instead!

DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 7 – New Gods features a full set of new playable characters: Orion, Mister Miracle, Big Barda, Kalibak, Granny Goodness, and Darkseid. Instead of the usual Super-Villain stack, you use two stacks of Homeworld cards. Each Homeworld has a special ability that all players can take advantage of, as many of the New Gods have spent time on both sides of the conflict between New Genesis and Apokolips. If you are Darkseid, you seek to conquer New Genesis...but so do your fellow super-villain players. The superheroes, conversely, compete to conquer Apokolips. When either Level 3 Homeworld is conquered, that ends the game and the player with the most VPs wins!

All of the hero and villain cards in this set feature a new keyword: Protector. By simply revealing a Protector from your hand, you may be able to thwart an invasion of your Homeworld.

—description from the publisher

Name: Import / Export: Captain Edition Cards
Description:
These 3 cards were available at the Model Ships pledge level of their Kickstarter campaign.

The three included cards are:

     Dark Flight Games (Illegal/Pirate)
     Exotic Fish (Agriculture/Contract)
     Exclusive Cards (Luxury/Supply)

Name: FOREST
Description:
Meet the environmentally friendly game of the year, FOREST!  The first game from Korea to launch at The New York Toy Fair.

How many trees can I grow?
Protect your forest by being the best Forest Ranger.  Watch out for crafty lumberjacks, and keep the animals safe from dangerous hunters.

Players take two fruit cards each, which reveal the kind of tree they are protecting. Fruit cards stay hidden. Then, players take turns to plant trees around the Mountain Board, adding lumberjacks, hunters, calamities, animals, and forest ranger cards. When the drawing pile runs out, players complete one last round. Then all players reveal fruit cards, tally up animal and tree points earned, and move pieces up the mountain on the score track. The furthest up the mountain is the winner.

Name: Battle For Souls: Presidential Souls Promo Pack
Description: Includes 7 new soul cards to battle over the souls of the first 7 US Presidents

Name: HEXO: Card Game
Description:
HEXO: Card Game will improve your visual acuity and spatial perception in a dynamic, fun and easy to learn card game based on technical drawing. The game has the features to be the ideal quick game to compete with friends, family, colleagues, couple... In which you'll cannot play just one game, you'll ask for a rematch!

On HEXO: Card Game you'll be challenged to find which of the 18 shapes of your 6 unique cards matches* with the active figure card. Who will be the fastest? Matches happens when one of the shapes of the card played coincides with one of the sides of the active figure. When no shapes matches, the move is wrong and a penalty will be applied.

If it's a match, you score one point! Place the card played by the dark side back on your zone and a new round begins.
In the following rounds you won't be able to score extra points with dark cards, but you can still play them to prevent other players from gaining points!

The first player who turns over 4 of his shape cards will be the winner of HEXO: Card Game!

Are you ready for a rematch?

-description from designer

Name: Kitchen Rush: KS Promos
Description:
A bundle of mini-expansions that were available during the Kickstarter for Kitchen Rush.

It includes:

     Fish Order cards and Fish Ingredient tokens
     Greek Cuisine Order cards
     Hungarian Cuisine Order cards
     Health Inspection Mini Expansion (cards and tokens)
     Wine Mini Expansion (Cellar tile and tokens)
     Food critic Mini Expansion (cards)


Note: 13 Chefs was also included in the pack sent to KS backers. Copies of the KS Promos sold after the campaign do not include it.

Name: Critical Fumblers In the Dungeon of Intellectual Doom...and the insanity that awaits them!
Description:
The dastardly mindflayer, Balzak Rimwrecker, Dreamscarrer from the Nigh Beyond (not Canada), has built a dungeon that only the most adept heroes can conquer.

These are not those guys.

Critical Fumblers is a solitaire, map-making, dungeon crawler that satirizes this genre. It won 3rd place in the 2017 Solo PnP Contest under the "dungeon crawler" category, and 10th place in Best Overall Game.

Since this dead horse has not been beaten enough, I took the lamest and most outrageous monsters from my years of playing D&D (not the gelatinous cube, because that's the most awesome monster!) and combined them with some of our group's more entertaining fumble events to bring you a game about a party of idiots fighting the stupidest monsters ever, all explained in this huge run-on sentence.

In this game, you draw your map, move from room to room, encounter a lame monster, and fight using a dice-placement mechanic. Corner rooms have a slightly different mechanic, and the end game is a sort-of Choose-you-own-adventure storyline. You win by visiting all Corner Rooms and then returning to the center of the map. You lose by running out of light or a party wipe. All of this combined will give you about an hour of a comedy of errors... err, entertainment. Enjoy!

Name: Red Aurora
Description:
Red Aurora is a single-player game offering the player to relive the dramatic historical events of October 1917 in Petrograd as a member of the Military Revolutionary Committee attempting to overthrow the Russian Provisional Government. The game is played on two maps of Petrograd showing historically precise locations of stationed regiments, officer schools, bridges, important buildings and the Winter Palace itself. The player will take control of soldiers, Baltic Fleet sailors and Red Guards attempting to overcome the government forces consisting of Junkers, cossacks and Shock infantry.

Over the course of the game, the player prepares the coup organizing Red Guards, agitates garrisoned regiments, gathers revolutionary forces to prevent the government from bringing more troops into Petrograd and arresting the player. The revolutionary patrols seize crucial points in Petrograd, like train stations, communication centres and power plants, facing opposition from the government that tries to uphold the control of the city. The conflict escalates with the revolutionary forces encircling the Winter Palace and finally assaulting and seizing it during the dark October night. 
The game includes 58 historical events, played in variable chronology, and with 60 minutes of playtime offers excellent replayability. Will the Provisional Government be able to retain the control of Petrograd or will the shot from Aurora usher in a new era in the history of Russia?

Name: House of Boing
Description:
Each player picks a Room and chooses a Ball color. The player places 4 Balls of the chosen color in her or her room. Players should make sure the pivoting Doors on the Base of the House are in the open position.
     Agree on an official starter. The starter shouts “Boing!” and everyone starts bouncing his/her Balls into the House of Boing, trying to empty his/her Rooms at the same time.
     Players must always pick up and throw Balls with ONLY ONE HAND. Players can bounce Balls into the unit either through the Window in the side facing them, or bounce Balls up and into the Skylight hole at the top of the House of Boing. You cannot bounce Balls through the  Windows facing other players.
     If a Ball drops on the floor, the player who threw the Ball must immediately go and pick it up and get back to the game as quickly as possible.
     Hint: watch other player’s Rooms. If you see someone close to emptying his or her room, then try to bounce more Balls in the direction of his or her Room to stop them from winning.


Winning the Game:
The first player to empty his or her Room of Balls and close the pivoting Door is the winner.

Name: Five Seals of Magic: Circle V – Circle of Assistance
Description:
Small expansion that adds 25 scrolls (5 per player) to the game, scrolls of the Fifth circle.

     2: Diverge
     3: Retry
     4: Empower
     5: Cleansing
     6: Upgrade

Name: Trivial Pursuit: National Parks Travel Edition
Description:
Test your knowledge of America's National Parks with TRIVIAL PURSUIT®: National Parks Travel Edition. Trivia questions from 100 years of National Park history will challenge National Parks travelers, U.S. History buffs, students and families.

Roll the custom die to pick from six categories: Natural Wonders, Battlefields and Historic Sites, Cultural Heritage, Science and Nature, Wildlife and Wildcard. First player to collect 6 cards wins!

Hook the handy travel case to your backpack and play anywhere, around the campfire or even on the hiking trail!

Name: Neck of the Woods
Description:
The giraffes are hungry! - Can you help them reach the leaves in the tree?

It takes a steady hand and a clever mind to stack the blocks, reach the reward, and earn the most points.

On each turn, you must roll the die to determine which block you have to use. Keep on stacking turn after turn to stack your giraffe's neck as high as you can.

The higher the leaves are in the tree, the more points they're worth. - Stack as high as possible to win the biggest reward!

But beware. If your giraffe tumbles, you'll have to start all over, and the other giraffes might start chanting -

"Icarus lost his nee-eck! Icarus lost his nee-eck!"

Once all the leaves have been grabbed, everyone flips them over at the same time to count up their points. The player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Eagle Attack!: Market Garden to Arnhem, Sep44
Description:
This is a very simple (but not simplistic) and fast point-to-point ... the boggy Netherlands terrain made roads even more important, especially for armor/panzer ... regiment/brigade game about Market Garden. 8 one-day turns.

Rules are all of 3 pages.  Excellent intro to military/naval history boardgames for family and friends (over the holidays, etc.)  Already really popular at the club here in Oslo.

If Fog of War is used, German (hidden until engaged) strength can be Strong/historical, Weak, and Very Weak - Monty's Fantasy - with the games length ... the requirement to open a road/route up to Arnhem ... shortened accordingly.  The probability of each of those German strengths can be indicated by Dutch Resistance warning of panzers coming into the area ... or not.

—description from the designer

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Herb Garden and Pen
Description:
Both available at Essen Spiel 2017

Herb Garden allows you, after a successful Gather Action from a tile, to put a black pawn and move it further in each production phase. After some time, the herbs are grown and they allow to heal one wound. Otherwise this tile is considered part of the Camp for all in-game purposes.

Pen allows you, after a successful Gather Action from an animal resource, to put a black marker the space on this tile. If both spaces contain a black marker, this means that your animals are breeding. This tile then produces one food in each Production phase till the end of the game. Otherwise this tile is considered part of the Camp for all in-game purposes.

—description from the publisher

The Pen looks the same as the earlier released Runch
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock II
Description: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock II is a set of new sheets for use with the Noch mal! dice game. The new arrangement of colors provides a new game experience.

Name: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock III
Description: Noch mal!: Zusatzblock III is a set of new sheets for use with the Noch mal! dice game. The new arrangement of colors provides a new game experience.

Name: Quests of Valeria: Kickstarter Promo Cards
Description:
3 additional Guild Masters were included in the kickstarter version:


     Lantz the Viking Jarl - You gain 1 VP for every 2 citizens in your guild
     Ash the Chief Justice - You gain 4 VP if you have 1 of each quest type completed
     Grendyl the Half-Fae - You gain 1 VP for every quest you complete worth 2 VP or fewer


These cards were later made available as part of the rewards for backing Tantrum House Board Game Reviews: Season 5 Kickstarter campaign

Name: Piratjakten
Description:
Co-operativ children's game. The parents have been captured by pirates, and the children must free them from the bottom of the pirate ship. However, if they encounter pirates on their way, they may be forced to walk the plank, in which case they may be eliminated. If they manage to free the parents you win, but if all but one of the children are eliminated, you lose. Any player can move any playing piece, so it is not really player elimination, just playing piece elimination.

—User summary

Name: Knossus
Description:
Brave the Labyrinth and face the Minotaur! In this cat and mouse game, it's kill or be killed, and everyone for themselves. Dare you enter?

Based on the legend of Theseus and the Minotaur, Knossus is set in the ancient time, where 7 youths have been sent by the City of Athens, to be sacrificed to the minotaur in the labyrinth of King Minos.

It is designed to be a gateway game suitable for a family to play or as light relief between more heavyweight games. Gameplay style varies with the group - from fast and furious, action packed charging around the labyrinth, to tactical chess-like experience where strategic players face off in a game played several moves ahead.

The game plays by drawing 4 cards - you must choose two to control your hero, and two to control the Minotaur. They may be played in any order, and augmented by receiving the blessing of the gods from various shrines found in the labyrinth. There are also items to help you in your quest but you may only carry one at a time.

Balancing luck with strategy, Knossus is designed to engage the group for the whole 30 minutes - even eliminated players are still able to control the minotaur for that last sweet act of revenge. And there's nothing so satisfying as sending the monster charging into your rivals, slaying them, only to end his run on the point of your sword, winning you the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Revenge of the Dictators: Donald "the Drumpf" Dictator Promo Card
Description: This is a card first given out for free at Essen SPIEL 2017. It adds the role of the fictious Dictator Donald "the Drumpf".

Name: Back Alley
Description:
Back Alley is a variation of bridge, played with a standard deck of 52 cards including jokers.  One joker should be marked 'high' and the other joker 'low'.

In the first round, one card is dealt to each of the four players. In the next round, two cards are dealt to each player, then three, four, etc. all the way up to 13 cards. Then 13 cards are dealt again and you make your way back down to 1.

In each round, remaining cards are set to the side and the topmost card is turned over to reveal the trump suit. After the trump is set, players look at their hand and bid on how many tricks they think they can take. Bidding continues around the table in a clockwise direction until all players have bid. If a player thinks they can take all the tricks, they can board which is worth 13 points. The next player can double-board if they wish, which would be worth 24 points.

Player with the highest bid leads the first trick. All other players must follow suit if possible, or play a trump if unable to follow suit. The highest card, or highest trump cards, wins the trick. The player who won the trick leads the next card and play continues around the table until all players are out of cards.

If you meet your bid, you score three points for each trick bid and taken, plus one point for tricks greater than the bid. If the bid isn't met, it's minus one point for each trick missed. If a player boards and makes it, they score 13 points. If they board and don't get all the tricks, they get -13 points.

At the end of 26 hands, the player with the most points is the winner.

Name: Willi Wörterwurm
Description:
Willi the bookworm has eaten all the books and made a mess of all the letters. The players now have to clean up the mess and create new words.
Three theme cards are placed on the table, each player gets a certain amount of letters. Three letters are in the exchange area. The first player places a letter next to a theme card to start a word which fits that theme. The next player can start a new word for a different theme, or continue the current word by dding another letter. At the end of the turn, a player draws a new card.
Instead of playing a hand card, a player may take a letter from the exchange area and add it to any of the words, and must replace it from their hand. If this also doesn't work, they can discard a card. 
When a word is finished, the cards (which show a number of points depending on how often they appear in German) are put on a score pile and a new word for this theme can be started. If the players agree that it will be too hard to finish a word, they can discard the cards and start a new word.
Play continues like this until all cards have been played. Points in the discard pile are deducted from the points in the score pile, and the overall number is checked on a chart to see how well the group did.

Name: Maratón Mónaco
Description:
A trivia game. Up to four players or teams can play. The players advance in a track of 42 spaces (or "kilometers", hence the name of the game) by answering questions about six main themes.

In this version of Maratón in addition it is possible to bet in the answers of the other players, which are getting lost if the answer is wrong and being able to recover moving back the player marker a space in the board.

Name: Sweet Temptations
Description:
A basic roll-and-move game with trivia found in a centerfold of the April 3rd, 1990 edition of Family Circle Magazine. Players provide dice, pawns and a quantity of small chocolate candies referred to as "Chocolate Chunks" or "cc's".

The goal of the game is to be the first to reach Finish square without any cc's. Spaces on the board can add or subtract cc's. Some spaces allow you to answer chocolate related trivia questions found in the back of the magazine to discard extra cc's.

Name: Diesel Demolition Derby: Arenas
Description: Arenas are large cards with 15 more unique illustrations that represent venues constructed or set aside for this dangerous league. In some cases they are made to challenge the combatants, and in some others they are made to contain them. Every one throws a wrench into the proverbial machine and are recommended for those who have dabbled in the ‘Derby once or twice before.

Name: クレルソンと夜明けの展覧会 (Clerson to Yoake no Tenrankai)
Dungeon Fighter: Elder Dragon
Description:
Elder Dragon bonus card for Dungeon Fighter.
Published from Horrible Games at Spiel in Essen 2017 and is a reference to their game Dragon Castle introduced in Essen 2017 as well. To use the abilities of the Elder Dragon you use a tile from the Dragon Castle.

Name: Alien vs Predator: USCM Marines
Description:
Combining firepower with expert training - there is nothing they can't handle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Viral: Essen Bug Promo Card
Description:
Promo card from Corax Games in Essen 2017
(also available with other card names but same layout & rule, i.e. Berlin-Con-Bazillus printed 2021)

Event card:
The player who is the at the top of the Tie-Breaker Table may exchange 2 Zone tiles on the board.

(free translation of the original German text on card:
Der Spieler, der auf der Gleichstandtafel am weitesten oben liegt, darf 2 auf dem Spielbrett befindliche Zonenmarker vertauschen.)

Name: Long Long Line in HELL
Description:
You are the leader of the ogres group. Aim of this game is queuing your ogres (dice) a distribution stations and get a beautiful stone. Can receive stones of your choice from the player who placed the most dice at the distribution stations.

However, the demons are not very smart, so they will not move as you would expect. A player who successfully directs the ogres and get more stones than other players will win.

Name: Islet
Description:
You participated in the uninhabited survival contest. And survived to the final.
You must collect the ingredients to create tools, and use survival skills to earn the title of the best survival expert.

This is a 2-player, small-volume card game.
You choose the action card to execute the action, and create the necessary tools for survival.
The action card consists of day and night.
Complete the tool card through resources such as fruit, trees, vines, and stones.
Win by winning 15 points.

Name: Fat Turkey
Description:
Fat Turkey – The mini card game for 2–9 turkeys.

Farmer Jack is busy trying to fatten up his turkeys ready for market. As one of the turkeys your aim is to try and keep your weight down and avoid being selected.

Turkeys select cards from the food pile which will add to their weight. The food pile also includes cards such as Weight Loss, Poop and Feed Me which will enable turkeys to shed weight and distribute their food cards amongst other turkeys.

When Farmer Jack is selected from the food pile, the round ceases and the fattest turkey is selected for market and taken out of the game.

A strategic little card game played in rounds until only one turkey survives.

Name: SOS Galápagos
Description:
The Galápagos Islands are known worldwide as "The Enchanted Islands", a paradise of wildlife inhabited by species unique in the world, the same paradise that inspired Charles Darwin in his formulation of the Theory of Evolution — but any environmental change may disturb the delicate balance of the ecosystem that shelters these wonderful animals, putting their lives at risk!

S.O.S. Galápagos is a board game in which players take on the role of ecological activists whose mission is to rescue animals whose lives are threatened by irresponsible human activity. In order to rescue animals at risk, players must make the best possible use of their resources, which are represented by action dice and helper tokens.

The game lasts exactly twelve rounds, each of which is divided into five phases in this order:

Phase A) Threat
Phase B) Throwing the dice
Phase C) Player actions
Phase D) Resolving actions
Phase E) Preparing the next round

During a turn, a player can perform all the actions that their action dice and helper tokens allow. Through the use of both kinds of actions, players attempt to rescue animals at risk and to fight against environmental threats. At the end of the game, whoever has collected the highest number of rescue points will be declared chief rescuer and win.

The future of the Galápagos Islands is in our hands: To work, rescuers!

Name: Border Tensions
Description:
The summoner has brought forth factions from distant worlds to use as pawns in our game. Take your choice of Dragons, Robots, Wild West or Zombies as you take on your opponents. Use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows and you’ll win the game.

New factions are coming soon for expanded gameplay up to 8 players!

The most basic ruleset of the game works mainly like a matching game that can be played by anyone with the ability to add to 10.  Advanced rules turn this basic game into a battle of wits with chess-like decision making and strategy in nearly every card pull.  Rules are available for head-to-head 2 player games, free-for-all games of 3 and up and team games. Optional rules can also be applied that change up game play and strategies

Name: Barkolana
Description:
Barkolana is the official game of the Barcolana, the most populous sailing regatta in the world.
The winner is the first one to arrive, sailing in his boat a course full of unexpected marine trial, which,if passed, will make him gain money (called "bori", from the name of the wind of the city "bora"). At the end of his turn, the player can use the money to buy in the "bottega velica" (a sailor's shop) some items to make his boat stronger, like new sails, gps, bottle of wine to stop other players, and even cannons to shoot them or forbidden fan or engine (he must pay attention to the sea police).
Also, in each turn the wind will change, affecting the speed of the sailing boats.

—description from the publisher

Il gioco è molto semplice: chi arriva per primo alla casella finale del tabellone, vince la Barkolana. L’avanzamento delle pedine è regolato dal lancio di dado e, a seconda della casella in cui si capita, bisognerà eseguire un compito specifico, tenendo conto del vento a favore stabilito all’inizio del turno e valido per tutti i giocatori. Il giocatore che è di mano dovrà prendere un boro (moneta triestina), utile per acquistare gli strafanici (optional di potenziamento della barca) presso la Bottega velica.
L’aspetto divertente è che per raggiungere il traguardo i velisti avranno a disposizione mezzi non sempre regolamentari: il ventilatore, un motore o i cannoni ad esempio; se avrete la sfortuna di incappare nella Guardia Costiera, dovrete pagarne il prezzo subendo le relative penalità.
Inoltre in mare dovrete sapervi destreggiare di fronte a mille difficoltà: saper recitare una filastrocca in apnea ad esempio, scommettere o mantenere il silenzio radio.
Un’ottima occasione per cimentarsi con un gioco dell’oca molto originale ed imparare qualcosa di nuovo sulle regate veliche, da provare!

Nerdando.com

Name: Border Tensions: Zombies vs Wild West
Description:
A city taken over by Zombies and an old Wild West town find themselves side by side in a new land, forced into a battle for survival at their border. Together, you and your opponent use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows, and you’ll win the game.

Zombies and Wild West core game of Border Tensions for 2 players.  Can be combined with other core sets for multiplayer options.

Name: Border Tensions: Dragons vs Robots
Description:
A royal kingdom of Dragons and an army of Robots find themselves side by side in a new land, forced into a battle for survival at their border. Together, you and your opponent use the creatures of these lands to build and maintain a shared Defense Wall, while also strategically capturing as many Heroes as you can. Knock out your opponents’ attackers before the Blitz, or leave them with nothing but Shadows, and you’ll win the game.

Dragons vs Robots core set for 2 players. Combinable with other core sets for multiplayer.

Name: Achtung Panzer!: Fast Play WWII Rules for N Scale
Description: Company to task force combat in the World War II era. Designed for 9 mm, 10 mm & 1/144 scale models with no paperwork. Figure ratio is 1:4, ground scale is 2" = 100 yards and 15 minute turns. 20 page rule book plus 13 chart, misc. pages in spiral bound rule book. No minor country stats or scenarios provided

Name: Food Truck Champion: Helpers Mini Expansion
Description:
This mini expansion introduces 12 Helpers with powerful actions you can take in the game. Each card is double-sided, and as a Helper is activated, the card is flipped to reveal a new Helper with a different action. Can you time your actions wisely to take advantage of their powers and become the next Food Truck Champion?

—description from the packaging

Name: SECTRE
Description:
SECTRE is an abstract strategy game for 2-6 players with a goal of scoring points by building shapes from colors on the board. Pattern recognition skills are sharpened as shapes are picked out in an ever-evolving tapestry of color. Plan your moves accordingly to keep your options open. Your next move will always be on the tip of your tongue; can you manage to keep it a secret?

—description from the publisher

Name: Old School Tactical: Airborne
Description:
We all love 'em, a lot of film footage has been spent on them, they are the paratroopers of the 101st and 82 Airborne Divisions. The expansion includes a complete sheet of Airborne counters, rules for using them (paradrops, etc), six scenarios, and a HUGE 30" X 41" historical map

The airborne expansion for "Old School Tactical: Airborne" builds upon the popular series by adding the elite paratroopers of the United States into the mix.

Drop the steadfast troopers of the 82nd and 101st Aibrone Divisions behind enemy line into the darkness before the D-Day landings.

Fight in the fields and on the streets of the historically based map of Saint-Mère-Église.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Old School Tactical (Flying Pig Games)

Name: Old School Tactical: Volume II West Front 1944-45 – Pocket Battles
Description:
Pocket Battles, two 11" x 17" two-sided geomorphic  maps (four maps total), printed on 80-lb paper (the high-quality stuff you get in premium games) and four scenarios to play on them. One side of each game map will depict summer terrain in the European countryside, the flip side will depict the same area in the winter.  Perfect to expand the scenario possibilities in Old School Tactical Vol II.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Old School Tactical (Flying Pig Games)
